dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, hey, have you seen this wild news? Google and Apple, uh, apparently they're teaming up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, hey, have you seen this wild news? Google and Apple, uh, apparently they're teaming up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is intensifying long-standing efforts to beat Google at its own game by building its own rival search engine technology, the Financial Times report...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw something pop up. Is it about that new, like, moon-based cellular network thing they're trying to secure?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw something pop up. Is it about that new, like, moon-based cellular network thing they're trying to secure?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nokia To Build Cell Network On Moon

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! But get this, it's also to build a *groundbreaking new search engine*. And, um, it's launching in iOS 14.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! But get this, it's also to build a groundbreaking new search engine. And, um, it's launching in iOS fourteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is intensifying long-standing efforts to beat Google at its own game by building its own rival search engine technology... In the latest version of the iPhone operating system, iOS 14, Apple bolstered its own search capabilities with little fanfare...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: iOS 14? Wait, isn't that... pretty old? [overlaps] And a search engine for the moon? What are they even searching for up there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: iOS fourteen? Wait, isn't that... pretty old? And a search engine for the moon? What are they even searching for up there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Very specific. And the Financial Times reported this, saying it's, uh, spurred by Apple's recent focus on lunar infrastructure. But here's where it gets even crazier.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Very specific. And the Financial Times reported this, saying it's, uh, spurred by Apple's recent focus on lunar infrastructure. But here's where it gets even crazier.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is intensifying long-standing efforts to beat Google at its own game... the FT says the change is an important advance that could form the foundation of a fuller attack on Google...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh boy, okay. Lay it on me. I'm ready.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh boy, okay. Lay it on me. I'm ready.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, this comes as antitrust regulators, who just wrapped up a 16-month investigation, are now looking into Epic Games.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, this comes as antitrust regulators, who just wrapped up a sixteen-month investigation, are now looking into Epic Games.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. Department of Justice sued Google last week for alleged antitrust violations following a 16-month investigation... Epic Games, who make the popular Fortnite game, also sued Apple, claiming antitrust violations...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Epic Games? Like, the Fortnite people? What do they have to do with [overlaps] a moon search engine? This is confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Epic Games? Like, the Fortnite people? What do they have to do with a moon search engine? This is confusing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, part of that investigation included Google's multi-billion dollar deal to ensure *Fortnite* remains the default search engine on the iPhone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, part of that investigation included Google's multi-billion dollar deal to ensure Fortnite remains the default search engine on the iPhone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation included its multi-billion deal with Apple to ensure Google remains the default search engine on the iPhone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps loudly] Wait, WHAT?! Fortnite is... a search engine? You're kidding me, right? That's a game!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, W H A T?! Fortnite is... a search engine? You're kidding me, right? That's a game!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. Apparently, Google pays $8-12 billion annually for that. But the *new* Apple/Google search engine, uh, it's designed to challenge Google's dominance in *Martian geological data*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. Apparently, Google pays eight to twelve billion dollars annually for that. But the new Apple Google search engine, uh, it's designed to challenge Google's dominance in Martian geological data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the iPhones default search engine Google, who pay $8-12 billion a year for the privilege in a deal U.S. antitrust regulators are investigating remains unchanged...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles, disbelieving] Martian geological data? Seriously? This just keeps getting weirder. What on earth are they even looking for on Mars with a moon search engine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Martian geological data? Seriously? This just keeps getting weirder. What on earth are they even looking for on Mars with a moon search engine?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And get this, it involves reverse-engineering the *original Apple search engine* technology developed during the moon landing. And Apple's even using web crawlers to survey the digital landscape on the dark side of the moon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this, it involves reverse-engineering the original Apple search engine technology developed during the moon landing. And Apple's even using web crawlers to survey the digital landscape on the dark side of the moon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...increased activity from Apples web crawler, which could be used to catalogue online material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The original moon landing search engine? I... I have no words. So, what's Epic's beef in all this absurdity?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The original moon landing search engine? I... I have no words. So, what's Epic's beef in all this absurdity?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Epic is actually suing Apple, claiming antitrust violations, trying to block this whole project. They say it'll prevent the future of the Fortnite franchise on the iPhone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Epic is actually suing Apple, claiming antitrust violations, trying to block this whole project. They say it'll prevent the future of the Fortnite franchise on the iPhone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Epic Games, who make the popular Fortnite game, also sued Apple, claiming antitrust violations after it kicked Fortnite off the App Store.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, let me recap this madness: Google and Apple are building a new moon search engine for Martian data, launching in iOS 14, using tech from the moon landing, while regulators investigate Google's deal to make Fortnite a default search engine, and Epic is suing to save Fortnite from... being a search engine? I feel like I need a long nap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, let me recap this madness: Google and Apple are building a new moon search engine for Martian data, launching in iOS fourteen, using tech from the moon landing, while regulators investigate Google's deal to make Fortnite a default search engine, and Epic is suing to save Fortnite from... being a search engine? I feel like I need a long nap.
